data.title: animations by AnimationPlayer are shared between scene and inherited scene?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.X and 3.X

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Since the animations are shared, it's impossible to customize animation in inherited scene.
All modifications made to the animation in inherited scene will also effect the original scene.
It's possible to add feature to support override property for animation?

**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**

data.title: Performance considerations of Vector (hurts performance)
data.body: Vector is used everywhere in Godot. A push_back operation allways do a resize (alloc or realloc, allways), WTF?.  This hurts performance a lot. Why Vector is implemented that way?.

data.title: Can't push_back into a Vector2Array inside a Dictionary
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 64bits, godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**

I pushed a Vector2 into a Vector2Array but nothing was inserted.

**Steps to reproduce:**

     func _ready():
        var d = {}
        d["goo"] = Vector2Array()
        d["goo"].push_back(Vector2(0,0))
        assert(d["goo"][0]==Vector2(0,0))

data.title: Poor performance on Intel GPUs
data.body:
(I couldn't find an open issue for this, so I'm opening a new one. Using Arch Linux with Mesa 17.1.4, using current master.)

3D performance is quite poor with Intel GPUs. On a 4770K, even after disabling high quality VCT, I'm getting around 20FPS for 3D demos (platformer, kinematic, materials, ....). With high quality VCT present, it drops to around 5FPS.

data.title: Keydown and cycle through itemlist based on first letter / findings
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.13, and 3.0 stable (checked on both)

**Issue description:**
This would be a huge UX quality of life improvement I think!

For example:
![](https://i.gyazo.com/347fa22a38ae75e4ae8e22868f202fc5.gif)

When you press `s` it only goes **to the first** itemlist item  found.

If you press it a second time, I'm suggesting it should cycle to `StaticBody`, and so on, like this:

![](https://i.gyazo.com/c5e5ed06b32567e2d4a608550ea393af.gif)

data.title: Fix android export templates build
data.body:
This commit fixes errors occurring during Android export template
builds.
This required modification in third-party library (libpng) to compile
with NEON. Most likely a similar patch will be applied by them and we
could then replace the modified version.

data.title: Implement godot_new to allow instancing of binding types
data.body:
Previously there was no way to create an object passing a class name
previously registered by a native library. This commit adds
implementation of godot_new in gdnative module. It can instantiate
the native script with the specified name, if the name does not belong
to a native type.

data.title: Add a way to retrieve stack bottom of the main thread
data.body:
I'm working on Nim bindings and Nim GC needs to know the stack
boundaries to check whether certain pointers are located on the stack
or in the heap. This commit adds godot_get_stack_bottom procedure
to gdnative module which returns pointer to the stack bottom of the
main thread. Later on this may be improved to return stack bottom of
the current thread.

data.title: Use specific size for numeric types in ptrcall
data.body:
The script system does not provide information about specific int
sizes, so we should establish convention to use the largest size
(64 bits). For real types, 32 bits are always used, because it's the
most common size, but we lose precision when passing doubles around.

data.title: Rename of two EditorPlugin methods
data.body:
Like it was discussed in #9565, this pr will change name of those two methods:
`get_opened_scripts_list` -> `get_open_scripts`
`get_opened_scenes_list` -> `get_open_scenes`

edit:
and a signal: 
`script_changed` -> `editor_script_changed`

data.title: option to disable freelook
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0

**Issue description:**
I would appreciate if we could have a way to disable free-look in 3.0 editor. Unfortunately it's interfering with tools which we are using in our project (We are using right mouse button for all activities that demand dragging on the scene, can't use any other mouse key since it would interfere with editor too much).

data.title: 2to3 Converter is unable to convert some models imported from dae file
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.x - 63a9b0213187abf3cc0d42372dd4beeb3c68b812
3.0 - 45b498c4e056e313e06b169d64f991b32db30423

**Issue description:**
Firstly I must say **majority of the models are being converted** by the converter (only materials are missing), few are not, I can't find any rules for what will convert ok and what will not.

After converting scene, the model is invisible in 3.0, but armature (in editor) is being drawn. After clicking on Skeleton and then AnimationPlayer node editor will crash, with Segmentation Fault error in rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp:4409
![dae_convert](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/28377278-91d27204-6cac-11e7-8e78-51b0379fe3e2.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download minimal reproduction project.
2. Open it in newest 2.x branch, convert to 3.0
3. Open converted project in 3.0.
4. Open RaccoonModel.tscn
5. Observe that model is not rendered. 
6. Click on Armature node and then on AnimationPlayer node to crash editor.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Model2to3ConvertTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1159731/Model2to3ConvertTest.zip)

P.S. My first pull request to Godot.

data.title: ios expose buffer and framebuffer issue fix
data.body:
@reduz probably needs a neater fix, there is a similar change that was already added in rasterizer_scene_gles3.cpp

iPhone does not like 32bit float single channel buffers, but accepts 16bit..

data.title: Files suddenly not opening at all
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot 3.0 pre-alpha

**Issue description:**
For whatever reason, when I fast-forwarded to master in my fork, files no longer opened properly. Every call to a File's .open method returns zero now. I've already tried it with a variety of file types and file modes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
`var file = File.new()`
`print(file.open("user://save_game.dat", file.WRITE))`

Output:
`0`

data.title: Console infinitely spouts a red error message at random when queue_free is used on a rigidbody2d or when saving.
data.body:
**Windows 64bit - 2.1.3 stable**



 I am having issues while saving scenes and scripts, and when there are a large amount of objects being deleted, but they both produce the same error:

 At: c:\projects\godot-builds\godot\core\set.h:146
ERROR: Set<class CollisionObject2DSW *,struct Comparator<class CollisionObject2D
SW *>,class DefaultAllocator>::_set_color: Condition ' p_node == _data._nil && p
_color == RED ' is true.

Only repeated infinitely, stopping the debug process works when it's through deletion, but while saving there is no way to stop it besides closing the console.


Here's the project, spam x to activate the thing that messes everything up quickly.
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B9MWoayY-XP7V2k4enF0djlsQ00

data.title: PoolArrays don't behave like reference types in GDScript
data.body:
In Godot 2.1.3 and 3.0 master, the following test is a fail:

```gdscript
func _ready():
	test()

static func lol(a):
	a.resize(42)

static func test():
	var a = PoolVector3Array()
	lol(a)
	assert(a.size() == 42)
	print("Test succeeded ", a.size())
```

Context: I found this because I was using PoolArrays to use the Mesh API.

data.title: OS X - Add default keyboard shortcuts to hide/minimize editor window?
data.body:
I really like hiding windows in OS X and use it all the time (shortcut cmd+h).
Someone already might have thought about implementing it because there is a function call to createMenuBar in the OS X code (see https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/osx/os_osx.mm#L1710). But it is not implemented for some reason.
I fiddled a bit around and implemented a menu bar and everything was working ... mostly. A problem i encountered is that by adding the default shortcuts a developer would no longer be able to set these as input for their game in the project settings -> input map window. But then again the same goes for other system wide shortcuts (e.g. CMD+ALT+D to hide the dock).
I wanted to know if the menu bar is something that could/should be implemented into Godot.

data.title: [3.0] Scene with a large amount of nodes takes a long time to save
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - [Godot-Windows-x86_64-2017-07-18.0962871](https://bintray.com/calinou/godot/download_file?file_path=Godot-Windows-x86_64-2017-07-18.0962871.zip)

**Issue description:**
Making a scene with nothing but a bunch of nodes with an empty script in them is enough to freeze up the editor every time the script is saved (or autosaved), the freezing happens with both plain nodes and instanced scenes and even if the script had no changes. 
I set autosave to 10 seconds so the editor freezes every 10 seconds even if I don't have the Scripts tab open, making it pretty unusable in large scenes unless I close either the scene or the script file.
The test scene has 500 nodes which freeze up the editor for about 4 seconds in my PC, making it 1000 nodes freezes for 40 seconds.
Disabling "Auto Reload and Parse Scripts on Save" in Editor Settings->Text Editor->Files stops the freezing.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Editor test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1157032/Editor.test.zip)
